definition: to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The hairdresser opens a salon, the lawyer his or her own practice and so on.
sentences.chinese: 理发师开一间发型屋，律师重操旧业，等等。

sentences.english: Casual Encounters users say those people have simply resurfaced on their turf.
sentences.chinese: “随遇”的用户们说，那些人很快重操旧业。

sentences.english: When the War of Spanish Succession was over the buccaneers had no jobs, so they became pirates again.
sentences.chinese: 当西班牙战争结束时，这些海盗就又重操旧业。

sentences.english: After going straight for a bit, he returned to petty thieving again.
sentences.chinese: 走了一段正道后，他又重操旧业当起小偷来。

definition: one's old profession/trade of one's forebears
to totally stop doing something/to reform one's ways
lit. to wash one's hands in a gold basin (idiom)/fig. to abandon the life of an outlaw
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to go to jail/to be sent to prison
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
